meanings.definition: expropriators: those who take possession of (property) for public use or benefit
meanings.sent1: The expropriators claimed the land for building a new park.
meanings.sent2: The expropriators confiscated the house to build a school.
meanings.sent3: The expropriators decided to turn the empty lot into a community garden.
meanings.sent4: The expropriators swooped in and transformed the abandoned building into a library.
meanings.sent5: The expropriators made the area vibrant by converting it into a public space.

meanings.definition: expropriators: individuals or entities that seize or take away (property) from its owner
meanings.sent1: The expropriators took control of the company without permission.
meanings.sent2: The expropriators stole the valuable artwork from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The expropriators played a prank by moving all the furniture to another room.
meanings.sent4: The expropriators snatched the opportunity before anyone else could.
meanings.sent5: The expropriators grabbed the spotlight with their daring move.
